Description: Wall sherd (mended from three fragments) of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; interior: streaky brown with one thin reserved band; added red traces above band, red band lined in white below; on lower wall, large floral patter (rosette and petals) with incised outline and tongues; red paint on alternate section of floral pattern; exterior: cream slip; two friezes of goats grazing left, above, to right below; red paint on neck and on body of goats; filling ornaments: swastikas, stalked rosettes, dotted rosettes; dividing band with added red between friezes. One repair hole.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.222)
